channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China's central bank affirms supportive monetary policy stance at closely watched meeting
item.description: The PBOC head added the central bank plans to “increase the intensity of counter-cyclical monetary policy," state media said in Chinese, translated by CNBC.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Amid focus on elections, don’t take your eyes off markets
item.description: Focus on trading opportunities that might arise from this period of change in the White House.

item.title: Trump Media shares gain 10% in after-hours trading as voting in heated presidential election nears end
item.description: Shares in the former president's media company jumped after the company revealed a surprise earnings statement on Election Day.

item.title: Coinbase's big election bet is about to be tested
item.description: Coinbase emerged as a top corporate donor this election cycle, backing candidates the company viewed as supporting its pro-crypto agenga.

item.title: Is this the world's 'coolest hotel room' for baseball fans? Go inside to see the view
item.description: Travelers who stay at the hotel inside the Es Con Field Hokkaido stadium can watch baseball games from their rooms or while soaking in natural hot springs.

item.title: How your favorite social media apps are preparing for election conspiracies
item.description: Social media companies are under intense pressure to squash the spread of disinformation on their platforms during the 2024 elections

item.title: Move over Black Friday: Consumer interest in 'Travel Tuesday' soars
item.description: Search interest for "Travel Tuesday" rose more than 500% over the last two years, according to a report published Thursday by McKinsey & Company.

item.title: As China approaches WTO, analysts say Beijing-EU tariff spat unlikely to go 'too far'
item.description: China's commerce ministry said Monday that it had filed an additional appeal with the WTO over the EU's tariffs on its EVs, as bilateral talks have yet to lead to a breakthrough.

item.title: The U.S. election is a make-or-break moment for aid to Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainian officials are likely watching U.S. polls with more than a touch of nervousness this week, as the vote remains too close to call.

item.title: Trump says he will give RFK Jr. a major health role if he wins the White House. Here's what that means for patients, drugmakers
item.description: Some health experts say Kennedy, even in an informal role, could potentially lead to real consequences for patients, drugmakers and the nation's public health.

item.title: China consumer slowdown weighs on U.S. earnings again
item.description: From Apple to Starbucks, U.S. consumer brands are reporting yet another quarter of China sales declines.

item.title: Trump Media loses $19.2 million in third quarter, surprise Election Day filing reveals
item.description: Trump Media on Tuesday reported a loss for the third quarter along with a slight drop in already-meager revenue.

item.title: UK's ultra-rich feel the pinch from Labour's tax-raising budget
item.description: Britain's wealthy are feeling the pinch following a slew of targeted tax hikes in the Labour government's budget, with many saying they are making good on plans to leave.

item.title: Solid-state batteries may yet catch up — but silicon anodes are winning the race to power EVs
item.description: Silicon anodes appear to be leading the way in the race to commercialize next-generation battery technologies for electric vehicles.

item.title: Super Micro shares plunge 17% after company says no timetable for annual results, issues weak guidance
item.description: Super Micro, the embattled server maker, reported preliminary first-quarter results on Tuesday.

item.title: The next U.S. president could face a tax battle in 2025 — here's what it means for investors
item.description: The next U.S. president could face a tax battle in 2025 over expiring tax breaks enacted by former President Donald Trump. Here's what it means for investors.

item.title: British regulator says $19.5 billion Vodafone-Three merger could go ahead if remedies are adopted
item.description: Telecom firms Vodafone and Three's multibillion-pound merger could go ahead if the companies adopt proposed remedies from the U.K. competition regulator.

item.title: Nintendo profit plunges 69% as it cuts forecast for sales of ageing Switch console
item.description: Investors are waiting for news surrounding a successor to the Switch which they hope will re-energize Nintendo's gaming business.

item.title: Burger King parent Restaurant Brands falls short of third-quarter expectations
item.description: Net sales climbed 24.7%, largely thanks to the company's acquisitions of its largest U.S. Burger King franchisee and its Popeyes business in China.

item.title: Oil giant Saudi Aramco posts 15% drop in third-quarter profit but maintains dividend
item.description: Lower global oil prices, weaker demand and prolonged OPEC+ production cuts led by Saudi Arabia continue to impact crude prices.

item.title: What the stock market typically does after the U.S. election, according to history
item.description: Stocks typically rise after a presidential election, but investors need to be prepared for some short-term choppiness first, history shows.

item.title: Germany's government is on the brink of collapse — here’s what could happen now
item.description: Germany's ruling coalition has long been standing on shaky ground, but the situation has become critical in recent weeks, with a breakup more likely than ever.

item.title: China's Hisense aims to become the No. 1 TV company in the U.S. within 2 years, top executive says
item.description: Catherine Fang, president of Hisense International, spoke with CNBC in an exclusive interview Monday.

item.title: Chinese driver-assist startup announces $100 million in funding, touts 'deep cooperation' with Nvidia
item.description: Deeproute said it is part of the first batch of companies in China to obtain Nvidia's newer Thor chip for cars and will release a new system using it next year

item.title: Australia's central bank keeps rates unchanged at 4.35%
item.description: However, the RBA still said that underlying inflation "remains too high."

item.title: China reviews plan to increase local government debt
item.description: A closely watched meeting of China's parliament on Monday reviewed a proposal to raise the local government debt limit, according to state media.

item.title: Boeing machinists end strike after approving labor contract with 38% raises
item.description: The vote is the third time since September that Boeing's machinists are considering a new labor deal.

item.title: China's Singles Day shopping festival is more than halfway over. Here's how consumers are spending
item.description: Early indicators on China's biggest shopping event of the year reveal a pickup in select categories, and even predictions for modest sales growth overall.

item.title: Singapore Airlines will add first class, revamp cabins for longest flights
item.description: Singapore Airlines will add a first class to its ultra-long-range aircraft and increase the number of business class seats in race for high-spending travelers.

item.title: Trump's tariffs could trigger 'dramatic' price spikes on clothes, furniture, warns retail group
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has campaigned against Donald Trump's tariff proposals, calling them a sales tax on American consumers.
